derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: French, from rapporter 'bring back'

entry.def: If two people or groups have a rapport, they have a good relationship in which they are able to understand each other's ideas or feelings very well.

example.ex: He said he wanted 'to establish a rapport with the Indian people'...
example.tran: 他说他想“同印度人民建立友好关系”。

example.ex: The success depends on good rapport between interviewer and interviewee...
example.tran: 成功取决于采访者与被采访者之间的良好沟通。

means.word_mean: 1. relation of mutual understanding or trust and agreement between people
